commit_message:
Add Ironic inspector health checks

This patch add health checks for ironic_inspector container
and ironic_inspector_dnsmasq container. Inspector health is checked
using curl of the API interface and dnsmasq is checked using opened
port verification.

Change-Id: I0bcc713d342f6388750dd9dcecf439db3c59d651
(cherry picked from commit d03c53c3e4eda9ab6ead396f2b0559bb7444b561)

commit_message:
Add health check for OVN containers

This patch adds script for ovn_controller and ovn-dbs-bundle containers.
Health is check using verification of connection to OVN DB.

Change-Id: I9c8d0445b7f010838fe94dae2ae6fb86952fdeab
(cherry picked from commit b9905a052fd72aa3742f43cdc7356c252940e138)

commit_message:
Add QDR profile for metrics purposes.

This patch adds a profile class to enable deploying edge routers
for metrics collection purpose.

Partial-Bug: #1822054

commit_message:
Configuration changes to support Qdr-mesh topology.

These changes update router mode to edge or interior
depending on the node type. The mesh topology is
formed on controller nodes and remaining nodes will
connect to this topology. Also did changes to haproxy
to be able to expose the data through public network.

Depends-On: I44d2bf0c1c717cb9895e605f6900e5135ec7fc66
Change-Id: I01019e4a1af239739de9c7257514ff37d3aef08f

[{'created': '2019-01-17 12:31:27.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] Setup cluster definition based on the ansible limit option.

During upgrade we're re-creating the pacemaker cluster one node at a
time.  So we need to override the cluster definition.  We do this by
collecting the ansible_limit variable and mapping the controller
defined as member of the cluster.

Change-Id: Iece3451d3a99929ab364b23f61ef6cbc5fa0cf04
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/630956/
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/631282/
Implements: blueprint upgrades-with-os

commit_message:
Setup cluster definition based on the ansible limit option.

During upgrade we're re-creating the pacemaker cluster one node at a
time.  So we need to override the cluster definition.  We do this by
collecting the ansible_limit variable and mapping the controller
defined as member of the cluster.

Co-Authored-By: Jose Luis Franco Arza <jfrancoa@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Iece3451d3a99929ab364b23f61ef6cbc5fa0cf04
Implements: blueprint upgrades-with-os

commit_message:
Update ODL upgradeInProgress flag to new REST API

The OpenDaylight upgradeInProgress flag and REST API have moved from the
ODL Genius project to the ODL Serviceutils project in ODL Neon (master).

ODL Jira tracking moving TripleO to new flag:

https://jira.opendaylight.org/browse/INTPAK-218

There are additional docs, including links to both old and new REST API
definitions, in the Jira.

Also add corresponding release note.

Change-Id: I88912dfc64ea5211d8bde8f4f70a7ed1a3aa75fc
Signed-off-by: Daniel Farrell <dfarrell@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add serial extra-vars to the ansible command

Add serial extra-vars to the ansible command line
execution in order to override the serial value
for parallel execution on nodes

commit_message:
Add serial Ansible keyword as option for update/upgrade

Add serial ansible keyword option for update and upgrade
in order to run parallel execution on the overcloud Nodes.

Cli looks like:
$ openstack overcloud update run --serial 5

Change-Id: Id9e2f91a5c491c09ea3a44f6896af2b3a7fac480

to update the capabilities map automatically as well.

commit_message:
Add ability to generate an environment index

Right now the only way to find a sample environment is to either have
it explicitly referenced in the documentation or to browse the
environments directory file tree.  An index of all the generated
environments should be useful, and not difficult to create with the
tool.

This commit adds the ability to generate an RST-formatted index file
that contains the title, filename, and description of all the
environments generated by the tool.  For the moment the tox env is
just putting the index in the environments directory, but it might
be good to find a way to integrated it into tripleo-docs.

In the future the functionality added here can probably be extended
to update the capabilities map automatically as well.

Change-Id: I36729344f7abd347d84c3f85488ba5f8d9cd430d

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-06-20 20:51:56.000000000', 'message': "Begin adding environments with all params for a service

This is an easy way to expose all of the possible configuration
parameters for a given set of services.  It did require some more
modifications to the generator tool.  To handle things like the
Rabbit parameters that many services read but mostly won't want to
set, and the MonitoringSubscription parameters that are present in
most services, a method of hiding parameters based on a regex was
added.  Unit tests for the hiding-by-default functionality were also
added to verify everything was working as intended.

Only Cinder, Horizon, and Nova were done in this commit.  If everyone
is happy with this approach the other services can be added pretty
easily in follow-ups.

Change-Id: Icc86db852701e0df9f198f3401b9c2059b0dda43

commit_message:
Begin adding environments with all params for a service

This is an easy way to expose all of the possible configuration
parameters for a given set of services.  It did require some more
modifications to the generator tool.  To handle things like the
Rabbit parameters that many services read but mostly won't want to
set, and the MonitoringSubscription parameters that are present in
most services, a method of hiding parameters based on a regex was
added.  Unit tests for the hiding-by-default functionality were also
added to verify everything was working as intended.

dict default values are explicitly dumped to json and sorted by key
so their output is stable from run to run.

Only Cinder, Horizon, and Nova were done in this commit.  If everyone
is happy with this approach the other services can be added pretty
easily in follow-ups.

Change-Id: Icc86db852701e0df9f198f3401b9c2059b0dda43

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-21 17:56:20.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Add service config env with all Designate settings

This will not work until the Designate patches merge, but since
these are two separate and significant patch series I didn't want

[{'account_id': 2813, 'date': '2018-09-14 16:41:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2813, 'date': '2018-09-26 11:40:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 2813, 'date': '2018-09-26 14:45:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 5241, 'date': '2018-09-27 12:24:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6924, 'date': '2018-10-16 15:41:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 5241, 'date': '2018-12-04 19:14:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Revisiting this patch again and realizing that it misses important configuration. 1) We should override saslConfigName in the QDR configuration to not conflict with general purpose QDR, which can be deployed on controller in paralel. 2) Also /etc/sasl2 directory should be mounted, so that created sasl credentials survive container reboot and 3) if we really want to have ceilometer and collectd authenticate, we IMO have to have credentials created during deployment. All those points should be IMO completed before we will force plain SASL auth.'}, {'account_id': 6924, 'date': '2018-12-07 15:49:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 28504, 'date': '2018-12-14 15:17:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2019-07-26 17:53:12.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Abandoning this patch per the TripleO Patch Abandonment guidelines (https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/tripleo-specs/specs/policy/patch-abandonment.html). If you wish to have this restored and cannot do so yourself, please reach out via #tripleo on freenode or the OpenStack Dev mailing list.'}]

commit_message:
metrics_qdr: Use plain auth by default

We must not allow anonymous login by default.

This also move sasl stuff into auth section instead of ssl section.

Change-Id: Idd943ae6915aef6329b4652abfa5350b6bafced7

subject: DNR undercloud/overcloud with mariadb 10.3.10 and galera 3.23
messages:
[{'account_id': 20778, 'date': '2018-11-12 16:32:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 20778, 'date': '2018-11-12 21:06:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 20778, 'date': '2018-11-13 07:29:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 8871, 'date': '2018-11-13 10:45:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I noticed Zuul failed, I think you hit bug(s):

- tripleo-ci-centos-7-containers-multinode: https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1708704
- tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario000-multinode-oooq-container-updates: unrecognized error
- tripleo-ci-centos-7-standalone: unrecognized error

Some of the tests failed in a way that we did not understand. Please help us classify these issues so that they can be part of Elastic Recheck http://status.openstack.org/elastic-recheck/
For more details on this and other bugs, please see http://status.openstack.org/elastic-recheck/'}, {'account_id': 20778, 'date': '2018-11-30 00:06:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 20778, 'date': '2018-12-04 13:06:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

recheck
So it looks to me that both mariadb 10.3.1 and galera 3.23 are working fine, although not all tests passed due to random CI errors here and there.

Undercloud passing example:
http://logs.openstack.org/55/617355/3/check/tripleo-ci-centos-7-undercloud-containers/1bb1566/logs/undercloud/var/log/containers/mysql/mariadb.log.txt.gz:
2018-11-30  3:00:59 0 [Note] InnoDB: 10.3.10 started; log sequence number 1630824; transaction id 21


Overcloud passing example:

http://logs.openstack.org/55/617355/3/check/tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario000-multinode-oooq-container-updates/7fa0c61/logs/subnode-2/var/log/containers/mysql/mysqld.log.txt.gz
2018-11-30  3:58:58 0 [Note] InnoDB: 10.3.10 started; log sequence number 3753886; transaction id 2361
2018-11-30  4:00:49 0 [Note] WSREP: wsrep_load(): Galera 3.23(rXXXX) by Codership Oy <info@codership.com> loaded successfully.

I'm rechecking for good measure to see if I can clear some unrelated failures."}, {'account_id': 20778, 'date': '2018-12-04 20:53:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

OK, only the voting job "tripleo-ci-centos-7-standalone" failed, but prior to deploying the stack.

This is due to how I override container-images/overcloud_containers.yaml to force using an externally-built docker image (this is not enough to force this job to use my custom-built mariadb image)'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2019-07-26 17:53:05.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Abandoning this patch per the TripleO Patch Abandonment guidelines (https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/tripleo-specs/specs/policy/patch-abandonment.html). If you wish to have this restored and cannot do so yourself, please reach out via #tripleo on freenode or the OpenStack Dev mailing list.'}]

commit_message:
Validate upgrade-non-controller.sh to run in Controller nodes

This patch will make upgrade-non-controller.sh idempotent
in the way that if it's executed in a Controller node
it won't do anything.

This change won't work until we fix
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1542871
Because we are using an old version of JQ.

Closes-Bug: 1761124
Change-Id: Iac4f1e10884c55886f6ad4ca94f534b805d4764d

commit_message:
Update min tox version to 2.0

The commands used by constraints need at least tox 2.0. Update to
reflect reality, which should help with local running of constraints
targets.

Change-Id: I172e207a6dea2ae9835e1ad443fc42f68f43d4fe

commit_message:
Changing the method to obtain controller's FQDN

Changing the method Octavia's controller hostname is obtained from
the hostname executed in shell command to Ansible's ansible_fqdn fact.

Closes-Bug: 1784362
Change-Id: I4d3d79a419b922c9e506a112785dd0d5823bab9a

commit_message:
Add containerized services for networking-vpp ML2 driver

This patch add new containerized services for neutron server with
networking-vpp ML driver, as well as required VPP Neutron agent.

Implements: blueprint vpp-ml2-support

Change-Id: Idaed863d098b17bf1411deb7fb305af06bb5da12
Signed-off-by: Feng Pan <fpan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add image for networking-vpp ML2 driver and agent

This patch add new neutron server image which includes networking-vpp ML2 driver,
as well as a new container image for VPP Neutron agent.

Implements: blueprint vpp-ml2-support

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/599854/

Change-Id: Icb34b940fc8b34e1d34f74458c2cc3a503674f69
Signed-off-by: Feng Pan <fpan@redhat.com>

'}, {'created': '2018-08-23 12:44:51.000000000', 'message': 'Keep plan on update and store user env_files into swift

This review is a refactoring of the plan management
for the overcloud in order to keep track of the
environments files passed by the user, to simplify
the Upgrade and Update by updating the plan according
to whatever options the user has passed for the deployment.

The code upload user files (all user files, meaning the ones
outside of the plan) just for the tracking.
(in a following review, it should contains the life cycle
informations as well)

commit_message:
Keep plan on update and store user env_files into swift

This review is a refactoring of the plan management
for the overcloud in order to keep track of the
environments files passed by the user, to simplify
the Upgrade and Update by updating the plan according
to whatever options the user has passed for the deployment.

The code upload user files (all user files, meaning the ones
outside of the plan) just for the tracking.
(in a following review, it should contains the life cycle
informations as well)
Keep track of the -e info.

The process of the plan is done directly in the swift container
and just downloaded on the file system for the deployment.
(it removed all the code for the "missing_files" and the j2
templating on FS)

Change-Id: I6c4e0d7f1cec5fbac0a7869c998f17593b3e416d
Depends-On: I91ca29507997e4eed3863f2682fd4f605814fe4e

In the current workflows an auxiliary task is often used
to publish the data if the current task fails with an error.
This is not necessary, since Mistral supports the "publish-on-error"

commit_message:
Optimize mistral baremetal workflows

In the current workflows an auxiliary task is often used
to publish the data if the current task fails with an error.
This is not necessary, since Mistral supports the "publish-on-error"
parameter, which is recommended to use in the workflows.

This patch replaces the exising auxilary tasks with "publish-on-error"
and combines excess "on-success: send_message" + "on-error: send_message"
into a single "on-complete: send_message"

Change-Id: If4375fb505565391c5decc9fe52b0a974959af21

commit_message:
TLS derive parameters for VIPs and FQDNs

This auto generates a TLS certificate for the overcloud
by default.

If a certificate was provided by user, then user certificate will
be used for overcloud and not auto generated certificate.

Change-Id: Id218ccad7147055ef8f45bcc63fb1bf74d84de74

commit_message:
Poll heat events and send it to messaging queue

Instead of polling the heat events outside of the
mistral action, this review poll the heat events
into the mistral action directly and send the
events to a queue.
It bring to the ability the run a stack deploy or
update inside the workbook and wait heat to finish
to continue the tasks in the workbook

Change-Id: I8930fcc0bd607a3eef8ea8e0b1b7e5aeb7d68cc9

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-04 02:17:39.000000000', 'message': 'build universal wheels

By default setuptools produces a version-specific wheel file so
installation under other versions of Python require extra work at
install time. This change turns on "universal" wheel support, so that
the wheel file will be marked as supporting both Python 2 and 3.

Change-Id: Ib5500e5a5078e7c2239c1fbf1b5e5f7090271fd6
'}, {'created': '2018-10-08 09:05:49.000000000', 'message': 'Always build universal wheels

All of our projects are pure python, so we can build
universal wheels by default.

Change-Id: Ib5500e5a5078e7c2239c1fbf1b5e5f7090271fd6
'}]
commit_message:
Always build universal wheels

All of our projects are pure python, so we can build
universal wheels by default.

Change-Id: Ib5500e5a5078e7c2239c1fbf1b5e5f7090271fd6

commit_message:
Fix resume_guests_state_on_host_boot_enabled fact

NovaResumeGuestsStateOnHostBoot is a role parameter so we
need to get the value from there.

Conflicts:
      deployment/nova/nova-compute-container-puppet.yaml

Change-Id: I9e13491b6f86143f507d2b56fa1eed83204418d0
Closes-Bug: 1837731
(cherry picked from commit 835dcd56c95c304830ed14c8393a99ce2881ed5e)
(cherry picked from commit 8fe366434d622f446babc0d62acd65d44efce50d)

subject: Add periodic job template
messages:
[{'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2019-07-01 14:21:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2019-07-01 15:44:03.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to add-periodic'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2019-07-03 13:48:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 18955, 'date': '2019-07-04 10:33:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 27781, 'date': '2019-07-14 13:54:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2019-07-16 20:15:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I believe this was intentional as commit history shows that branch-specific jobs are supposed to remain in openstack/project-config.'}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2019-07-17 11:45:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> I believe this was intentional as commit history shows that branch-specific jobs are supposed to remain in openstack/project-config.

Was it? In other projects I see that periodic-stable-jobs is on the master among the templates (e.g.: [1])

(The template [2] ensures that the periodic jobs will run on stable branches only)

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/.zuul.yaml#L309
[2] https://github.com/openstack/openstack-zuul-jobs/blob/master/zuul.d/project-templates.yaml#L1125-L1146'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2019-07-17 14:36:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The history is:

* I initially imported it before the goal was defined: Ia182e4dcf1a0b8e3af124b6676b20e6adb55f76b
* When the goal was defined it said not to include branch-specific stuff, so I removed it again: Ia54bd7d29717e2fb025c9547b852c4ec00cbcbd2
* When Doug implemented the goal, it got added back: I4c5227d740cdb0bc9e08ccdce27b0ca73fb4ded3
* Doug then removed it again as part of a patch removing master-only jobs (but this job is stable-only?): I727a9ac03781f86845d1af0b2a2ae672665b30db'}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2019-07-18 08:35:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

This history is a bit confusing to me. I don't understand why heat's case differs from other projects'. In other projects the auto-generated template additions (e.g.: [1][2]) were merged and still in place.

Also, if you check currently there isn't a stable periodic job on heat stein [3], while there are for other projects. But of course, if heat is a special case, then I can accept it, but I don't really understand why it should be without periodic job. :)

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/601370/
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/597880/
[3] http://logs.openstack.org/periodic-stable/opendev.org/openstack/heat/stable/"}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2019-07-18 14:33:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> This history is a bit confusing to me.

Yes, me too :)

Doug is on vacation, but maybe he can help clarify when he gets back.'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2019-07-24 12:51:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

remove +2 before we got more clear for the background'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2019-07-26 15:20:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

I checked with Doug and we can't think of a reason this should have been removed:

http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-dev/%23openstack-dev.2019-07-26.log.html#t2019-07-26T14:17:35

so let's go ahead and re-add it. Thanks for catching this."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-01 14:21:46.000000000', 'message': "Add periodic job template

Periodic stable jobs don't run on stein, only up till rocky as
periodic-stable-jobs template is missing from master and stein
branches.

Change-Id: Ic7fa6a2bef3db1f6f2548d1c792e0cef29787586
"}]
commit_message:
Add periodic job template

Periodic stable jobs don't run on stein, only up till rocky as
periodic-stable-jobs template is missing from master and stein
branches.

Change-Id: Ic7fa6a2bef3db1f6f2548d1c792e0cef29787586

commit_message:
Skip processing network info if not defined

If role_networks or network_cidrs is not defined, the jinja parsing
fails because NoneType is not iterable when doing a
'if value in none_type_var'

Change-Id: I477f0b840b2a0d2646ba947a88f5264d330ea4eb
Closes-Bug: #1837644

[{'created': '2019-07-10 11:36:09.000000000', 'message': "Fix ironic package list

Without this patch, ironic would fail to install on CentOS, as
libffi-dev doesn't exist (and other packages have the same problem).

This should fix it.

Change-Id: I2a10ce390815962b55897ddc45da995e4e45f9c0

commit_message:
Fix ironic package list

Without this patch, ironic would fail to install on CentOS, as
libffi-dev doesn't exist (and other packages have the same problem).

This should fix it.

Change-Id: I2a10ce390815962b55897ddc45da995e4e45f9c0

commit_message:
Persist region name in overcloudrc

This is useful when deploying a cloud that doesn't use the default
region name.

Change-Id: I21b462f78b32cd334acdf8a5644b70b1f24c8162
Closes-Bug: #1804449
(cherry picked from commit 7cd99c8d13e539d3cef89e743678813a8f06aefd)

commit_message:
Persist region name in overcloudrc

This is useful when deploying a cloud that doesn't use the default
region name.

Change-Id: I21b462f78b32cd334acdf8a5644b70b1f24c8162
Closes-Bug: #1804449
(cherry picked from commit 7cd99c8d13e539d3cef89e743678813a8f06aefd)

[{'account_id': 8478, 'date': '2019-07-11 08:22:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2019-07-11 09:15:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Clean cherry-pick, looks good.

Thanks for creating the patch to Queens, too. However, the patch is blocked by the binary dependency issue, so first the fix of that should be merged ( If9befe4115c64c2fda52321002ba5fe1124eaf7c ).

A suggestion about to not to miss any branch in the future: if you cherry-pick the patches branch-by-branch then it's less likely you'll miss any branch. Projects, who follow the Stable Policy process [1] usually require that. Thanks!

commit_message:
Add entry_point for oslo policy scripts

With the setup.cfg entry it can  be called directly from
oslo.policy.

$oslopolicy-policy-generator --namespace heat

This will get the effective policy that’s being executed.

Change-Id: Iad2e71819f4847f47dd17d3cd4afa78e6b3f52a7
Story: #2005055
Task: 29573
(cherry picked from commit 5bdcaeff018782a956fd8228e04ddd2169c353c6)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-05 09:39:35.000000000', 'message': "Define the Integrated-gate-compute gate template

tempest-full job run all services API and scenario tests (non slow)
and this job is part of Integrated-gate gate template which run on
multiple services (nova, neutron, cinder, glance, placement) check
and gate pipeline.

But there are many unrelated tests run on each project gate. For example,
neutron gate run cinder only tests and fail due to cinder bugs. There is
no point of breaking the neutron gate due to cinder only test failure and
slow down the neutron development phase.

This is what we dicussed in Train PTG in denver to improve the integrated
gate[1] and came up with idea of split the integated-gate template into
much logical way so that only dependent services tests run on their gate.

One way was to move the service only tests to service tempest plugin side
but Tempest is used by interop as well as on production cloud testing so
moving the test is not good idea.

This commit propose the idea of defining the 'Integrated-gate-compute'
gate template for nova gate which will run only nova, neutron, cinder
and glance tests.

ML discussion: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-May/005871.html

Next step will be to replace the Integrated-gate-py3 template with new
Integrated-gate-compute template on nova gate.

It will also help to disable the non-nova related serviecs and tests which
cannot be disabled from tempest-full job.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/qa-train-ptg

Change-Id: I807d4cac6214395df292a6955686ea44677c3481

commit_message:
Define the Integrated-gate-compute gate template

tempest-full job run all services API and scenario tests (non slow)
and this job is part of Integrated-gate gate template which run on
multiple services (nova, neutron, cinder, glance, placement) check
and gate pipeline.

But there are many unrelated tests run on each project gate. For example,
neutron gate run cinder only tests and fail due to cinder bugs. There is
no point of breaking the neutron gate due to cinder only test failure and
slow down the neutron development phase.

This is what we dicussed in Train PTG in denver to improve the integrated
gate[1] and came up with idea of split the integated-gate template into
much logical way so that only dependent services tests run on their gate.

One way was to move the service only tests to service tempest plugin side
but Tempest is used by interop as well as on production cloud testing so
moving the test is not good idea.

This commit propose the idea of defining the 'Integrated-gate-compute'
gate template for nova gate which will run only nova, neutron, cinder
and glance tests.

ML discussion: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-May/005871.html

Next step will be to replace the Integrated-gate-py3 template with new
Integrated-gate-compute template on nova gate.

It will also help to disable the non-nova related serviecs and tests which
cannot be disabled from tempest-full job.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/qa-train-ptg

commit_message:
Linting hardening with pre-commit

- Adds bashate test using v0.6.0
- Bump pre-commit-hooks release to v2.2.4
- Bump ansible-lint release to v4.1.0
- Fix some minor flake8 errors

Change-Id: I5962c162628a7d0b8516bd6c93ce0b098750228f
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Support TLS deployments with KernelDisableIPv6 enabled

Bind to 127.0.0.1 in case ipv6 is disabled. Set a hiera value
localhost_address, so that it can be used in tls_proxy.pp to
unambiguously connect to those services.

Change-Id: Ide761c21dc87dadc722e27c9b8a7b68194164cb2
Related: rhbz#1703460
(cherry picked from commit d48d1bdb37a4262ffe36ae5003312dfdfad083ab)

(1 comment)

Thanks for the patch!!

Besides not making all tests with volume types, I think it would be would to test the `get_changed_fields` method in the unit tests.

This method is not currently being tested (my oversight) and I don't expect this patch to add full coverage for the method, but it would be good to create a new test file `cinderlib/tests/unit/persistence/test_base.py` and at least test the changes introduced by this patch.

The downvote is for the comment in the `functional/base_tests.py` file, and I won't hold this patch on account of not having tests for `get_changed_fields`.  Though it would be great to have it."}, {'account_id': 27615, 'date': '2019-07-18 10:43:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 27615, 'date': '2019-07-18 10:46:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 27615, 'date': '2019-07-19 08:38:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 9535, 'date': '2019-07-23 16:42:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

[{'created': '2019-07-15 17:16:45.000000000', 'message': "Set extra specs for volume

During volume creation, a volume_type and volume_type_id is assigned
to a volume only when extra_specs is passed.
This patch appends a fake extra spec to volume tests so they're always
assigned a volume type and similarly for associated snapshots.

This patch also corrects the functionality where a resource with
'volume_type_id' field is assumed to have a 'volume_type' field
which isn't the case for snapshots.

Change-Id: If7816bf3deb37c526b86b0baed500bebe637bd40

commit_message:
Fix: Snapshot creation with volume types

This patch corrects the functionality where a resource with
'volume_type_id' field is assumed to have a 'volume_type' field
which isn't the case for snapshots.
This patch also adds minimal test coverage for get_changed_fields
method.

Closes-Bug: #1836724

Change-Id: If7816bf3deb37c526b86b0baed500bebe637bd40

commit_message:
Update api-ref location

The api documentation is now published on docs.openstack.org instead
of developer.openstack.org. Update all links that are changed to the
new location.

Note that the api-ref lives at
https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/network/ and not /networking (that
was changed years ago). This change fixes this as well.

Note that redirects will be set up as well but let's point now to the
new location.

For details, see:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-July/007828.html

Change-Id: I492ee1fe97ef0cdae0db0524d5b4df373ba07d41

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-25 17:31:00.000000000', 'message': 'Skip tests in UsersV3TestJSON / Changes to ListProjectsStaticTestJSON

Adds a skip_check condition to UsersV3TestJSON to skip if immutable
user source is true. resource_setup in this class attempts to create
users, which will not work if the environment is an LDAP directory
for example.

Secondly, changes were made in ListProjectsStaticTestJSON in order
to prevent failure when the os_primary project is not in the
default domain. Instead of checking to see if the projects in
question are both in the default domain, check to see if they are
in their respective correct domains.

Change-Id: I7aff87feff335c7007b06deed5eadbc6153e093d
Partial-Bug: 1777047
'}, {'created': '2019-07-25 17:32:03.000000000', 'message': 'Skip tests in UsersV3TestJSON / Change ListProjectsStaticTestJSON

Adds a skip_check condition to UsersV3TestJSON to skip if immutable
user source is true. resource_setup in this class attempts to create
users, which will not work if the environment is an LDAP directory
for example.

commit_message:
Skip tests in UsersV3TestJSON / Change ListProjectsStaticTestJSON

Adds a skip_check condition to UsersV3TestJSON to skip if immutable
user source is true. resource_setup in this class attempts to create
users, which will not work if the environment is an LDAP directory
for example.

Secondly, changes were made in ListProjectsStaticTestJSON in order
to prevent failure when the os_primary project is not in the
default domain. Instead of checking to see if the projects in
question are both in the default domain, check to see if they are
in their respective correct domains.

Change-Id: I7aff87feff335c7007b06deed5eadbc6153e093d
Partial-Bug: 1777047

commit_message:
shim standard_attr db for neutron-lib

This patch shims the attributes of the neutron.db.standard_attr module
to reference neutron-lib's implementation to allow consumers to move
over to lib's standard_attr at their leisure. Once all consumers are
moved over we will remove these neutron shims.

Change-Id: Ie3f55432a772b3e51a45252fa57fe5c9fa9cbe40

commit_message:
api-ref: touch up the os-services docs

Make it clear that the first GET /os-services response sample
is for 2.11 and make the version suffix format for the 2.69
example match the other response examples, i.e. "(v2.x)".

Also mention that PUT /os-services/{service_id} only allows
nova-compute services. Before Pike it was possible to update
non-nova-compute services though it didn't really make sense.

Change-Id: I585582710884a53d91f4453011d3407a94efe1e3

messages:
[{'account_id': 30683, 'date': '2019-07-12 15:52:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2019-07-12 15:52:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-12 15:52:33.000000000', 'message': "Skip tests in TrustsV3TestJSON when the environment has an immutable user source

Many OpenStack clients use immutable user sources, so tests that attempt
to create, change, or delete users in their routines do not apply to these
clients' test bed and create technical debt. This change adds a simple
condition in skip_checks to skip the entire test class if the environment
is configured to have an immutable user source. If so, a skipException is
 raised and the entire class is not executed.

Change-Id: I8c1c1df25401157c667bce97d4995f738eec8e05
"}, {'created': '2019-07-12 16:02:48.000000000', 'message': 'Skip tests in TrustsV3TestJSON with immutable user source

commit_message:
Skip tests in TrustsV3TestJSON with immutable user source

Adds a simple condition in skip_checks to skip the entire test class
if the environment is configured to have an immutable user source. If
so, a skipException is raised and the entire class is not executed.

Partial-Bug: 1777047

Change-Id: I8c1c1df25401157c667bce97d4995f738eec8e05

(1 comment)

I'm less -1 on this than before given the clunky nature of trying to correlate instance actions to migration records in the API, especially if multiple migrations have happened to the same server in the same day. I still don't really like duplicating the initiating user_id (and likely project_id) in the migration record though since it overlaps with server actions. A better way might be to store the request ID on the migration record so you can go from the migration record you care about directly to the associated instance action to get the user_id/project_id information, but would want input from others (like Dan Smith) on that directly. Obviously adding user_id/project_id to the migration records is trivial but it is overlap which smells like technical debt to me."}, {'account_id': 26458, 'date': '2019-07-24 00:39:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

Some feedback from customers.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-07-25 02:09:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-07-25 12:34:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

At this point the spec needs to be updated regardless of using instance actions as an alternative solution - there are several comments inline that would need to be addressed to clean this up before it can be approved. Also, as noted inline, if we add user_id to the migration record I think we also need to add project_id since they go together.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-07-25 20:24:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Add user_id to the migrations

The blueprint proposes tracking the user_id and project_id of the user that
initiated a server migration and exposing those values in the API.

Co-Authored-By:Jason SUN (sunjia@inspur.com)

Change-Id: I8aa2b9be5b53ba13c8921dbb66b6b7d4c57e9f6c
Blueprint: add-user-id-field-to-the-migrations-table

commit_message:
Never give up on res_mysql_monitor

Configure pacemaker to never give up on the res_mysql_monitor
resource and to recheck 5 seconds after a failure. This is
achieved using migration-threshold and failure-timeout
options *1.

*1 https://clusterlabs.org/pacemaker/doc/en-US/Pacemaker/1.1/html/Pacemaker_Explained/_failure_response.html

Change-Id: If19bea77eb5dee9e9eeff105ab98dce1b2de9f74

commit_message:
[RHEL8] promotion-testing-hash-master release file

In order to test periodic fs01 jobs, we need
promotion-testing-hash-master release file for RHEL8 so
that tripleo-current gets promoted.

https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/task/1146

Change-Id: Iafc0a3ce3d882b2e60fe2c484dc188a8ff73ba40
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-26 09:58:49.000000000', 'message': 'Update all columns in metrics on an update to refresh TTL

Cassandra Time to Live (TTL) is applied per-column in a
row, and with a default TTL for the table.  The Cassandra
driver appears to have been written with a misunderstanding
that the TTL was per-row, and as a result the update
statements were written to avoid writing all cells.
But that results in some cells in the row not being updated,
and after their TTL expires they are removed, so a metric
query may result in partial data (updated_at set but
metric_id and created_at missing).

This fix changes the statement used when a new measurement
is received to use the same insert statement for the metric
row and thus refresh the TTL for all the columns.

A follow on patch should be created to remove the Update
statements for Measurements, and consider refactoring/removing
the caching model.

Change-Id: I6b7636a52e8bdb2ce8ad97f839acb6184cd58a8b
Story: 2005832
Task: 35872
(cherry picked from commit d66d78c338835272b926836c06d1b5f101f1ff22)
'}]
commit_message:
Update all columns in metrics on an update to refresh TTL

Cassandra Time to Live (TTL) is applied per-column in a
row, and with a default TTL for the table.  The Cassandra
driver appears to have been written with a misunderstanding
that the TTL was per-row, and as a result the update
statements were written to avoid writing all cells.
But that results in some cells in the row not being updated,
and after their TTL expires they are removed, so a metric
query may result in partial data (updated_at set but
metric_id and created_at missing).

This fix changes the statement used when a new measurement
is received to use the same insert statement for the metric
row and thus refresh the TTL for all the columns.

A follow on patch should be created to remove the Update
statements for Measurements, and consider refactoring/removing
the caching model.

Change-Id: I6b7636a52e8bdb2ce8ad97f839acb6184cd58a8b
Story: 2005832
Task: 35872
(cherry picked from commit d66d78c338835272b926836c06d1b5f101f1ff22)

commit_message:
Add CI job for ironic

Adds four new CI jobs for testing centos/ubuntu binary/source deploys
with ironic enabled. These are run only when there are changes to the
ironic role.

Performs some simple testing by creating a node using the fake-hardware
hardware type and creating a server.

Change-Id: Ie669e57ce2af53257b4ca05f45193cb73f48827a
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/664011

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-18 07:16:26.000000000', 'message': 'Fix ironic inspector iPXE boot with UEFI

The ironic inspector iPXE configuration includes the following kernel
argument:

initrd=agent.ramdisk

However, the ramdisk is actually called ironic-agent.initramfs, so the
argument should be:

initrd=ironic-agent.initramfs

In BIOS boot mode this does not cause a problem, but for compute nodes
with UEFI enabled, it seems to be more strict about this, and fails to
boot.

Change-Id: Ic84f3b79fdd3cd1730ca2fb79c11c7a4e4d824de
Closes-Bug: #1836375
(cherry picked from commit 7b9397566a66eb19b2c687d293c55fb3e05bc5fd)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix ironic inspector iPXE boot with UEFI

The ironic inspector iPXE configuration includes the following kernel
argument:

initrd=agent.ramdisk

However, the ramdisk is actually called ironic-agent.initramfs, so the
argument should be:

initrd=ironic-agent.initramfs

In BIOS boot mode this does not cause a problem, but for compute nodes
with UEFI enabled, it seems to be more strict about this, and fails to
boot.

Change-Id: Ic84f3b79fdd3cd1730ca2fb79c11c7a4e4d824de
Closes-Bug: #1836375
(cherry picked from commit 7b9397566a66eb19b2c687d293c55fb3e05bc5fd)

commit_message:
support VM resizing with vpmem data migration

Check vpmems before doing resize, only support resizing to
more vpmems and must remain the old vpmems request.
In the migration process, the vpmems data will be migrated too,
and then the old vpmems data will be zeroed.

Change-Id: Ibcd436fc4bb01d32d701018e0e3ce7439f562153
Partially-Implements: blueprint virtual-persistent-memory
Co-Authored-By: He Jie Xu <hejie.xu@intel.com>

commit_message:
update migrations_context to support migration with vpmems

introduce two fields into migration_context obj, 'old_vpmems'
is used to hold the vpmems info before migration, 'new_vpmems'
is for new vpmems allocation.

Change-Id: I7b51ef7457f615dc15a548cccafae0605bd82225
Partially-Implements: blueprint virtual-persistent-memory
Co-Authored-By: He Jie Xu <hejie.xu@intel.com>

commit_message:
API: parse pmem related flavor extra spec

Add extra specs properties as below:
hw:pmem=4GB,SMALL

Change-Id: Ib8ab33eff31189484aa56a39e46235209f5acb4f
Partially-Implements: blueprint virtual-persistent-memory

commit_message:
libvirt: boot VM with vpmems and cleanup vpmems when destroying

Add the vpmems config into guest config xml from the
vpmems info in the instance object, then users can build
a VM with vpmems. Also this patch add the support for
cleaning the data on the backend dev of the virtual pmems when
destroying the VM.

Change-Id: I30501725a7320a2a1e22a712ae9adee1a1773519
Partially-Implements: blueprint virtual-persistent-memory
Co-Authored-By: He Jie Xu <hejie.xu@intel.com>

commit_message:
scheduler: translate vpmems request to placement request group

Parse the virtual pmems request from instance and translate
the request to placement request group.

Change-Id: Idf98386767d319013195224d2e1e2508c2099ff3
Partially-Implements: blueprint virtual-persistent-memory
Co-Authored-By: He Jie Xu <hejie.xu@intel.com>

commit_message:
Update api-ref location

The api documentation is now published on docs.openstack.org instead
of developer.openstack.org. Update all links that are changed to the
new location.

Note that redirects will be set up as well but let's point now to the
new location.

For details, see:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-July/007828.html

Change-Id: Ide95dd5544f5f0578daba7c9c3dfd3f716646841

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-18 05:16:39.000000000', 'message': "Optimize method list_opts() in watcher/conf/opts.py

Actually list_opts() return a list like[1], So we don't need to
convert list to dict and then convert to list[2].

The reason why we need to convert it before is to put together
the same group of configuration objects, but we don't need it
actually.

Now, the list_opts()'s result like this[3].

Reference:
[1]. [(Group1,[cfgObj1,cfgObj2....]),(Group2,[cfgObj3,cfgObj3....])..]
[2]. https://github.com/openstack/watcher/blob/375ae32fadb8a165f112874ccb8645b637c1ae0a/watcher/conf/opts.py#L51-L52
[3]. [(Group1,[cfgObj1]),(Group1,[cfgObj2])..]

Change-Id: I50fcc5f812be42038852662639fb10c6dd2f6f72
"}, {'created': '2019-07-18 05:18:15.000000000', 'message': "Optimize method list_opts() in watcher/conf/opts.py

commit_message:
Optimize method list_opts() in watcher/conf/opts.py

Actually list_opts() return a list like[1], So we don't need to
convert list to dict and then convert to list[2].

The reason why we need to convert it before is to put together
the same group of configuration objects, but we don't need it
actually.

Now, the list_opts()'s result like this[3].

Reference:
[1]. [(Group1,[cfgObj1,cfgObj2....]),(Group2,[cfgObj3,cfgObj3....])..]
[2]. https://github.com/openstack/watcher/blob/375ae32fadb8a165f112874ccb8645b637c1ae0a/watcher/conf/opts.py#L51-L52
[3]. [(Group1,[cfgObj1]),(Group1,[cfgObj2]),(Group2,[cfgObj3,cfgObj3....])..]

Change-Id: I50fcc5f812be42038852662639fb10c6dd2f6f72

commit_message:
Update api-ref location

The api documentation is now published on docs.openstack.org instead
of developer.openstack.org. Update all links that are changed to the
new location.

Note that redirects will be set up as well but let's point now to the
new location.

Note that some APIs have been renamed, use the new name.

For details, see:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-July/007828.html

Change-Id: I5587335d5670196e4f5bfeb70a5a4724557aaa22

Looks good to me, but needs a stable review.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-07-10 09:10:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

I am not sure if claiming support of a new feature (that was already working ... see "Declare multiattach support for HPE MSA") should be considered as new feature for end-users. If that's the case it should be thought in the context of stable reviews.

I think it's fine for me, as is, but someone from stable should validate.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-07-10 14:54:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

This should be rebased on the stein release request so they go in order.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-07-10 14:55:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-07-10 15:08:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

From a stable team perspective I don't agree with that HPE MSA driver backport to enable multiattach support. I don't see 3rd party CI for that driver on the change on stable/rocky at all, let alone testing multiattach support. The change is trivial, yes, but that doesn't mean we should backport a feature - especially if it's not tested by the vendor's 3rd party CI. I don't know how much the cinder stable core team will agree with me (smcginnis likely won't but jungleboyj might since he was initially -1 on the backport), but I'm definitely -1 because of the semantic versioning on this proposed release. If we don't revert the backport the version should be a minor version bump."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-07-10 15:08:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Also note that it appears the driver-specific release note doesn't get published with the other cinder release notes. I'm not sure where those driver release notes get built and published."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-07-10 15:13:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I've proposed a revert of that rocky backport here:

https://review.opendev.org/#/c/670086/"}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-07-10 15:25:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Agreed with Matt. The revert can be merged to keep the same version if necessary.'}, {'account_id': 16708, 'date': '2019-07-10 17:28:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: -Code-Review

I guess I don't have the full story on the driver change. Sounds like the feature was already there in the driver during the rocky release and just had the reporting of the feature backported and not the feature itself? To be on the safe side, I am going to remove my vote until we get to the bottom of things."}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2019-07-19 06:05:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

subject: Update all columns in metrics on an update to refresh TTL
messages: [{'account_id': 16222, 'date': '2019-07-22 12:53:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 16222, 'date': '2019-07-22 12:53:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 16222, 'date': '2019-07-25 12:26:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Workflow'}, {'account_id': 21922, 'date': '2019-07-25 12:28:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 26141, 'date': '2019-07-25 12:28:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 16222, 'date': '2019-07-26 09:58:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked\n\nThis patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/queens as commit f46109b80a2fe97b20b53fa2c4a70beaafa6af93'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-22 12:53:25.000000000', 'message': 'Update all columns in metrics on an update to refresh TTL

Cassandra Time to Live (TTL) is applied per-column in a
row, and with a default TTL for the table.  The Cassandra
driver appears to have been written with a misunderstanding
that the TTL was per-row, and as a result the update
statements were written to avoid writing all cells.
But that results in some cells in the row not being updated,
and after their TTL expires they are removed, so a metric
query may result in partial data (updated_at set but
metric_id and created_at missing).

This fix changes the statement used when a new measurement
is received to use the same insert statement for the metric
row and thus refresh the TTL for all the columns.

A follow on patch should be created to remove the Update
statements for Measurements, and consider refactoring/removing
the caching model.

Change-Id: I6b7636a52e8bdb2ce8ad97f839acb6184cd58a8b
Story: 2005832
Task: 35872
'}]
commit_message:
Update all columns in metrics on an update to refresh TTL

Cassandra Time to Live (TTL) is applied per-column in a
row, and with a default TTL for the table.  The Cassandra
driver appears to have been written with a misunderstanding
that the TTL was per-row, and as a result the update
statements were written to avoid writing all cells.
But that results in some cells in the row not being updated,
and after their TTL expires they are removed, so a metric
query may result in partial data (updated_at set but
metric_id and created_at missing).

This fix changes the statement used when a new measurement
is received to use the same insert statement for the metric
row and thus refresh the TTL for all the columns.

A follow on patch should be created to remove the Update
statements for Measurements, and consider refactoring/removing
the caching model.

Change-Id: I6b7636a52e8bdb2ce8ad97f839acb6184cd58a8b
Story: 2005832
Task: 35872

commit_message:
Fix rdo-release install

The URL for rdo-release package is version-less and redirects to latest
stable version. This becomes problematic when stacking older stable
versions as dependencies might not be met or newer and incompatibile
ones might get installed.

Closes-Bug: #1833696

Change-Id: Icb07dcb4c9a3950a3c31a3a8dcb8d0b4c713fdb1
(cherry picked from commit 8b31dce38b630ba3ed1883bcf91a90d296ae44f2)
(cherry picked from commit fb3b6e4baa5a990da70c8b43bca181959a610278)
(cherry picked from commit ed120e335fadc901f9547e347e3c3a51b278bc73)

subject: Remove Swift from default DISABLED_PYTHON3_PACKAGES
messages:
[{'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-07-11 16:48:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-07-11 18:56:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Note the related stuff in tempest for the py3 job(s) that disable swift:

https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/454ddc7d04596d03f40ca0a12a8e15c8ce647941/.zuul.yaml#L166

Tempest will be a bit trickier because it's branchless."}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2019-07-20 14:43:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Note the related stuff in tempest for the py3 job(s) that disable
 > swift:
 > 
 > https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/454ddc7d04596d03f40ca0a12a8e15c8ce647941/.zuul.yaml#L166
 > 
 > Tempest will be a bit trickier because it's branchless.

Good point. I have prepared the integration job for swift which enabled py3 on jobs by default[1] and make it run on py3 after this patch.

This patch can be tested with this to verify the swift installed under py3 and running fine. https://review.opendev.org/#/c/671554/ (I made this patch as Depends-On in 671554).

any existing job (tempest-full, tempest-slow, grenade-py3 etc) which disable swift on job side can be kept same to keep them working on stable branches without any effect. 

any project which need swift tests running as integrated gate also good as they use new template which does not block swift on py3 - https://review.opendev.org/#/q/topic:refactor-integrated-gate-testing+(status:open+OR+status:merged)

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/src/commit/504190d2adc4c0a31bf19b17349bec2bd20250a6/.zuul.yaml"}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2019-07-20 14:54:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

NOTE- grenade-py3 jobs on master gate is stein->master will still install swift on py2.7[1] because in stein swift is still in disabled list.

We can only tests swift on py3 in grenade-py3 after Train release only when base branch for grenade will be Train with this patch. 

- http://logs.openstack.org/53/670353/1/check/grenade-py3/7d49eb5/logs/old/devstacklog.txt.gz#_2019-07-11_20_36_18_760'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2019-07-22 06:24:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

results are good observed in https://review.opendev.org/#/c/671554/.

lgtm. thanks'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2019-07-26 06:43:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-21 11:39:58.000000000', 'message': "Ignore --limit for localhost plays

If using the kayobe --limit <hosts> argument, only those hosts matching
the limit will have an inventory generated for Kolla Ansible. This can
cause problems for Kolla Ansible, even when using a similar limit via
--kolla-limit <hosts>, since it gathers facts for all hosts, and expects
all host variables to be defined.

This change adds a new 'ignore_limit' argument to the playbook running
methods, which allows us to override and ignore the --limit argument
provided by the user, ensuring that we always run these plays.

Change-Id: I104d6af48ddd916460ee454e17a50a2475de6bff
Story: 2004805
Task: 28960

commit_message:
Ignore --limit for localhost plays

If using the kayobe --limit <hosts> argument, only those hosts matching
the limit will have an inventory generated for Kolla Ansible. This can
cause problems for Kolla Ansible, even when using a similar limit via
--kolla-limit <hosts>, since it gathers facts for all hosts, and expects
all host variables to be defined.

This change adds a new 'ignore_limit' argument to the playbook running
methods, which allows us to override and ignore the --limit argument
provided by the user, ensuring that we always run these plays.

Change-Id: I104d6af48ddd916460ee454e17a50a2475de6bff
Story: 2004805
Task: 28960

commit_message:
Add and switch to the newly created opensuse-15 nodeset

opensuse-150 nodeset is referring to openSUSE 15.0, which is still in
maintenance but openSUSE 15.1 has been released already. "opensuse-15"
is going to refer to the "latest openSUSE 15.x" build released and
working for OpenStack going forward, so add this nodeset and use
it by default going forward.

Change-Id: Ic3f4d6998a66da5226bc95088d7e3c83dfe737ce

commit_message:
Use default exchange for direct messaging

Lots of exchanges create problems during failover under high
load. Please see bug report for details.

This is a step 2 patch.

Step 1 was: only using default exchange
when publishing.
Step 2 is to update consumers to only listen on default exchange,
happening now in T release.

Change-Id: Ib2ba62a642e6ce45c23568daeef9703a647707f3
Closes-Bug: #1789177

commit_message:
Update api-ref location

The api documentation is now published on docs.openstack.org instead
of developer.openstack.org. Update all links that are changed to the
new location.

Note that redirects will be set up as well but let's point now to the
new location.

For details, see:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-July/007828.html

messages:
[{'account_id': 29018, 'date': '2018-11-21 09:53:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-11-21 09:53:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html

commit_message:
New labels support and simple fixes

- Added new fields to labels: node_uuid, instance_uuid and status.
  The status label is only available if the sensor provides this
  information in the data.
- Updated the support for the new labels in the driver
- Fixed extract_unit in the metric_names function
- Changed regex in the metric_names function and added
  examples to help understand what each regex will do.
- Updated tests
- Updated data2.json to have different information for the new labels

Change-Id: I7887c698fc8df76ba151d628ab30b9a0475a691b

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-10 01:02:38.000000000', 'message': "Enable tenant networking type to be set

Ironic's CI makes extensive use of VLAN based networking
and the newer neutron plugin hardcodes the tenant networking
type to vxlan which is naturally problematic.

Enables the value to be set with a new parameter which is in-line
with the current plugin naming scheme, and supports the prior name
used in the neutron plugins and neutron-legacy plugin.

Change-Id: I55874c1ce82898e9dfb81505d8f3b14abde33579
"}, {'created': '2019-01-10 15:13:32.000000000', 'message': "Enable vlan networking for newer neutron plugin

Ironic's CI makes extensive use of VLAN based networking
and the newer neutron plugin hardcodes the tenant networking
type to vxlan which is naturally problematic. It also lacks the
ability to set the necessary constraints for vlan networking
which are added for vxlan networking.

This patch enables the type of tenant networking to be defined
as vlan, and enables for a physical network vlan range mapping
setting to be configured which is required for a vlan to be
allocated upon network creation.

Change-Id: I55874c1ce82898e9dfb81505d8f3b14abde33579
"}, {'created': '2019-06-05 13:41:19.000000000', 'message': "Enable vlan networking for newer neutron plugin

Ironic's CI makes extensive use of VLAN based networking
and the newer neutron plugin hardcodes the tenant networking
type to vxlan which is naturally problematic. It also lacks the
ability to set the necessary constraints for vlan networking
which are added for vxlan networking.

This patch enables the type of tenant networking to be defined
as vlan, and enables for a physical network vlan range mapping
setting to be configured which is required for a vlan to be
allocated upon network creation.

Change-Id: I55874c1ce82898e9dfb81505d8f3b14abde33579
"}, {'created': '2019-06-11 08:59:18.000000000', 'message': "Enable vlan networking for newer neutron plugin

Ironic's CI makes extensive use of VLAN based networking
and the newer neutron plugin hardcodes the tenant networking
type to vxlan which is naturally problematic. It also lacks the
ability to set the necessary constraints for vlan networking
which are added for vxlan networking.

This patch enables the type of tenant networking to be defined
as vlan, and enables for a physical network vlan range mapping
setting to be configured which is required for a vlan to be
allocated upon network creation.

Change-Id: I55874c1ce82898e9dfb81505d8f3b14abde33579
"}]
commit_message:
Enable vlan networking for newer neutron plugin

Ironic's CI makes extensive use of VLAN based networking
and the newer neutron plugin hardcodes the tenant networking
type to vxlan which is naturally problematic. It also lacks the
ability to set the necessary constraints for vlan networking
which are added for vxlan networking.

This patch enables the type of tenant networking to be defined
as vlan, and enables for a physical network vlan range mapping
setting to be configured which is required for a vlan to be
allocated upon network creation.

Change-Id: I55874c1ce82898e9dfb81505d8f3b14abde33579

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-24 13:37:23.000000000', 'message': 'Stop testing mock functionality

There's no particular reason for us to be verifying mock's behavior.
They have their own unit tests for doing that.

This is specifically a problem right now because mock changed its
behavior in 3.0.0 and broke this test: "Issue #36366: Calling stop()
on an unstarted or stopped unittest.mock.patch() object will now
return None instead of raising RuntimeError, making the method
idempotent."

Change-Id: I57db9bad15cab343e152615e115e2ba3ac4d87fe
Closes-Bug: 1830429
(cherry picked from commit f8f6b14088637fd87de7cf385b840d6b5e5f9b22)
'}]
commit_message:
Stop testing mock functionality

There's no particular reason for us to be verifying mock's behavior.
They have their own unit tests for doing that.

This is specifically a problem right now because mock changed its
behavior in 3.0.0 and broke this test: "Issue #36366: Calling stop()
on an unstarted or stopped unittest.mock.patch() object will now
return None instead of raising RuntimeError, making the method
idempotent."

Change-Id: I57db9bad15cab343e152615e115e2ba3ac4d87fe
Closes-Bug: 1830429
(cherry picked from commit f8f6b14088637fd87de7cf385b840d6b5e5f9b22)

commit_message:
Add missing remote_src param for copy

Change[1] introduced tempest to multi-node, but didn't copy the
generated clouds.yaml from the right location.
This patch corrects this.

[1] I1f07fc996990273bfb8ef41cdcf7cb9a183a6d3c

Change-Id: I46cce7c37db20a3b83008f1618b9f19b4a1bb836

commit_message:
Don't send existing attributes in value_specs for neutron update

When updating we merge the property keys in value_specs, but there
is no need to send attributes that have not changed to neutron
as part of update api call.

Change-Id: I6df86a8dc9c4e64e2b370d3c2744d44712cd2ce2

messages: [{'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2019-07-25 01:34:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2019-07-25 10:38:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 21909, 'date': '2019-07-25 11:15:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2\n\nrecheck'}, {'account_id': 30381, 'date': '2019-07-25 22:35:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 21909, 'date': '2019-07-26 02:14:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-25 01:34:13.000000000', 'message': 'wait_for_introspection_to_finish_error set status FAILED

Currently when wait_for_introspection_to_finish_error is reached,
the _introspect workflow will pass as a success even when it
actually failed. This means that the retry logic in the calling
workflow is never triggered.

wait_for_introspection_to_finish_error is hit in downstream CI
when ironic-introspector is under too much load to respond
to status poll requests.

This change also ensures callers to the
tripleo.baremetal.v1.introspect can override the default concurrency
so that this can be changed when required.

Change-Id: Ifd88ff9175bc6ca583e3826c59787680e25fbea3
Partial-Bug: #1836976
'}]
commit_message:
wait_for_introspection_to_finish_error set status FAILED

Currently when wait_for_introspection_to_finish_error is reached,
the _introspect workflow will pass as a success even when it
actually failed. This means that the retry logic in the calling
workflow is never triggered.

wait_for_introspection_to_finish_error is hit in downstream CI
when ironic-introspector is under too much load to respond
to status poll requests.

This change also ensures callers to the
tripleo.baremetal.v1.introspect can override the default concurrency
so that this can be changed when required.

Change-Id: Ifd88ff9175bc6ca583e3826c59787680e25fbea3
Partial-Bug: #1836976

(2 comments)

Some comments inline.  I think it would be a good idea to turn the "Checklist" section into an actual checklist -- i think some of the duties have gotten lost in the paragraph format.  I'm thinking something like the release schedule, where you've got Release-XX weeks.  You can say that the timing is approximate, but it would be a really handy chart for the Release CPL to have to keep track of things, because, as you know, the Release CPL always has a lot of other stuff going on!'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2019-07-26 04:56:44.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

At the weekly Glance meeting on 2019-01-24 it was agreed that the
Release CPL will tag beta release at latest milestone 1 and change the
database migration constant to open development for database

commit_message:
Update Release CPL doc about db migration change

At the weekly Glance meeting on 2019-01-24 it was agreed that the
Release CPL will tag beta release at latest milestone 1 and change the
database migration constant to open development for database
migrations.  This patch updates the appropriate section of the
Glance Contributor's Guide.

Change-Id: I54fdc8a9c84db055ae26845cd3743a29a7daa072

commit_message:
Persist region name in overcloudrc

This is useful when deploying a cloud that doesn't use the default
region name.

https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1721085

Change-Id: I21b462f78b32cd334acdf8a5644b70b1f24c8162
Closes-Bug: #1804449
(cherry picked from commit 7cd99c8d13e539d3cef89e743678813a8f06aefd)

WIP: Add testcase to check problem with stack deletion

It was observed that when a resource is in UPDATE_IN_PROGRESS
the deletion of a stack fails.  This adds a test case to check
this scenario.

Task: #35879
Story: #2006261

Change-Id: I4c9f4ace302f6a3bf0f64a62c5fbc4eb4257f4fe
Signed-off-by: Andreas Florath <Andreas.Florath@telekom.de>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-09 20:35:29.000000000', 'message': 'Limit max ports per rpc for dhcp_ready_on_ports()

The Neutron dhcp agents reports all ready ports to the Neutron
server via the dhcp_ready_on_ports() rpc call. When the dhcp agent
gets ports ready faster than the server can process them the amount
of ports per rpc call can grow so high (e.g. 10000 Ports) that the
neutron server never has a chance of processing the request before
the rpc timeout kills the request, leading to the dhcp agent
sending the request again, resulting in an endless loop of
dhcp_ready_on_ports() calls. This happens especially on agent startup.

To mitigate this problems we now limit the number of ports sent
per dhcp_ready_on_ports() call.

Closes-bug: #1834257
Change-Id: I407e126e760ebf6aca4c31b9c3ff58dcfa55107f
(cherry picked from commit 76ccdb35d4b09106aa8adc97528b02f0fd8acbcc)
'}]
commit_message:
Limit max ports per rpc for dhcp_ready_on_ports()

The Neutron dhcp agents reports all ready ports to the Neutron
server via the dhcp_ready_on_ports() rpc call. When the dhcp agent
gets ports ready faster than the server can process them the amount
of ports per rpc call can grow so high (e.g. 10000 Ports) that the
neutron server never has a chance of processing the request before
the rpc timeout kills the request, leading to the dhcp agent
sending the request again, resulting in an endless loop of
dhcp_ready_on_ports() calls. This happens especially on agent startup.

To mitigate this problems we now limit the number of ports sent
per dhcp_ready_on_ports() call.

Closes-bug: #1834257
Change-Id: I407e126e760ebf6aca4c31b9c3ff58dcfa55107f
(cherry picked from commit 76ccdb35d4b09106aa8adc97528b02f0fd8acbcc)

commit_message:
Limit max ports per rpc for dhcp_ready_on_ports()

The Neutron dhcp agents reports all ready ports to the Neutron
server via the dhcp_ready_on_ports() rpc call. When the dhcp agent
gets ports ready faster than the server can process them the amount
of ports per rpc call can grow so high (e.g. 10000 Ports) that the
neutron server never has a chance of processing the request before
the rpc timeout kills the request, leading to the dhcp agent
sending the request again, resulting in an endless loop of
dhcp_ready_on_ports() calls. This happens especially on agent startup.

To mitigate this problems we now limit the number of ports sent
per dhcp_ready_on_ports() call.

Closes-bug: #1834257
Change-Id: I407e126e760ebf6aca4c31b9c3ff58dcfa55107f
(cherry picked from commit 76ccdb35d4b09106aa8adc97528b02f0fd8acbcc)

[{'account_id': 26458, 'date': '2018-10-24 08:44:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 26458, 'date': '2018-10-24 08:53:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-11-01 15:05:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

What is the difference between this spec and https://review.openstack.org/#/c/580336/ ? I'm confused as to why we need two specs."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-11-01 15:28:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

I think this could/should be combined with the other spec, we don't really need two separate specs for essentially the same end goal - being able to control the delete_on_termination flag for volume attachments, either that being updating existing attachments from server create or when attaching new data volumes to an existing server."}, {'account_id': 26458, 'date': '2018-11-02 08:02:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

> What is the difference between this spec and https://review.openstack.org/#/c/580336/
 > ? I'm confused as to why we need two specs.

Thanks Matt for your reveiw.
This spec implements the configuration of delete_on_termination when attaching a volume to the server. The other is the delete_on_termination of the volume attached to the server, you can update its value True or False.
Hmm...This can be combined with *that* spec, but I don't recommend it.
Because I think this spec is relatively simple to implement, the requirements are clear, and easier to understand. Another API interface to the implementation of the choice is controversial.
If I put them together, the application should look bad and misleading. But these two specs can be done at the same time.
If you insist your opinion, I can combine them :P"}, {'account_id': 26458, 'date': '2018-11-02 08:23:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 15888, 'date': '2018-11-06 08:13:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 15888, 'date': '2018-11-06 08:23:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Latter, thinking again, this seems OK as data on the volume belongs to users too, it could be safer to delete them too. But you should combine this one to the other patch, since they are actully similar operation, and lets not add two microversion for this.'}, {'account_id': 26458, 'date': '2018-11-06 08:31:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 26458, 'date': '2018-11-06 08:55:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

 > operation, and lets not add two microversion for this.

Ok, I will combine this patch with https://review.openstack.org/#/c/580336/.'}, {'account_id': 26458, 'date': '2018-11-06 11:53:12.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

This is combined into [1].

LGTM'}, {'account_id': 30200, 'date': '2019-07-25 06:00:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 23312, 'date': '2019-07-25 06:00:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 26490, 'date': '2019-07-25 06:01:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 30395, 'date': '2019-07-25 06:04:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 30380, 'date': '2019-07-25 06:16:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 30077, 'date': '2019-07-25 09:11:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-07-25 12:23:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10: Code-Review-1

(11 comments)

The spec is a bit confusing since the proposed change doesn't really match other parts of the spec. It also seems, in parts, to be conflating this with https://review.opendev.org/#/c/580336/ which is a different spec and more complicated change.

If this were simply, allow a user to specify delete_on_termination when attaching a volume, and return that value in GET APIs, then this is a pretty straight-forward spec and I think I'd be in favor of it, but as it stands the spec is a bit too confusing for what the actual proposed change is for me to be comfortable with it as written."}, {'account_id': 26458, 'date': '2019-07-25 13:08:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

(5 comments)

Thanks Matt, I am sorry, this spec and https://review.opendev.org/#/c/580336/ are somewhat repetitive, because the reason for the splitting and dismantling has led to many places not being accurate enough. If you have time you can update, and you can add 'Co-Authored-By' if you are willing :)"}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-07-25 13:36:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10: Workflow-1

Thanks Brin, I'll update this today."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-07-25 19:45:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-07-25 19:47:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11: Code-Review+2

I cleaned this up and think it's pretty straight-forward and simple, nothing involving changes to the compute service. Given today is Train spec freeze and Brin is probably asleep right now I took the liberty of addressing my comments so we can try to get this approved. I don't really consider my edits as something which bars me from +2ing this."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-07-25 20:01:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

(2 comments)

Straightforward, useful, clean. Agree with omitting update-a-volume-attachment, as noted in the spec and per warning in the API reference.'}, {'account_id': 26458, 'date': '2019-07-26 02:13:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

> I cleaned this up and think it's pretty straight-forward and

Thanks Matt for working for this, I agree with the changes made to this spec, and I will add the implementation code later."}]

commit_message:
Support delete_on_termination in volume attach api

This blueprint proposes to support passing delete_on_termination during
volume attach so the attached volume can be deleted when the server is
deleted.

APIImpact

bp:support-delete-on-termination-in-server-attach-volume
Change-Id: I6a9d0a2f2b918c82b6f56e601f821362a50ff7ce

commit_message:
Set canonical hostname in octavia config inventory

Use the canonical hostname from the tripleo-ansible-inventory instead of
the host name to catch the proper fqdn for that host. This is required
for proper binding of the health manager ports within neutron.

Closes-Bug: #1837043

Change-Id: I5d23b02ca46a40b39dc25a8367541b0a6e517982

commit_message:
Skip processing role_networks if not defined

If role_networks is not defined, the jinja parsing fails because
NoneType is not iterable when doing a 'if value in none_type_var'

Change-Id: Ie89e6f914f11ad337e79b7af89568fd1a74568d1
Closes-Bug: #1837644

[{'created': '2019-06-18 15:11:25.000000000', 'message': "Fix broken function version during webhook update

When updating a webhook which uses a function_version other than 0
using qinlingclient, the function_version of that webhook would be
reset to 0.

This is caused by the argument 'function_version' of the webhook
update command is set to a default value 0, so it is always passed
to the Qinling API even though user doesn't specify it.

commit_message:
Fix broken function version during webhook update

When updating a webhook which uses a function_version other than 0
using qinlingclient, the function_version of that webhook would be
reset to 0.

This is caused by the argument 'function_version' of the webhook
update command is set to a default value 0, so it is always passed
to the Qinling API even though user doesn't specify it.

Change-Id: Ic1071a5ba7bfd12161a423c99d888857a786a1ba
Story: 2003478
Task: 24744

commit_message:
Immutable user source: All admin V3

If the keystone user source is immutable, such as an LDAP
active directory implementation, tempest tests that try
to create or delete a user will fail. Instead of failing,
we would like them to skip. This change uses a testtools
decorator to avoid unnecessary modifications and allow those tests
to skip. In [1], I introduced the config setting that allows
this to happen.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/585536/

Change-Id: I59d29ec9a01ea84496aa6c6acf0246151161e89e
Partial-Bug: 1777047

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-19 00:05:06.000000000', 'message': "Avoid logging traceback when detach device not found

We use the oslo.utils save_and_reraise_exception context manager in our
detach device code and catch specific exceptions that mean 'not found'
and raise DeviceNotFound instead. When we do that, the
save_and_reraise_exception context manager logs an ERROR traceback of
the original exception, for informational purposes. This is misleading
when trying to debug other issues, as it makes it look like the caught
exception caused a problem.

This passes the reraise=False keyword arg to the context manager and
sets the 'reraise' attribute to True only if we are not going to raise
a different exception.

Related-Bug: #1836212

Change-Id: Icce1e31fe3ebcbf9e4897bbfa57b7f3d1fba67a3
"}]
commit_message:
Avoid logging traceback when detach device not found

We use the oslo.utils save_and_reraise_exception context manager in our
detach device code and catch specific exceptions that mean 'not found'
and raise DeviceNotFound instead. When we do that, the
save_and_reraise_exception context manager logs an ERROR traceback of
the original exception, for informational purposes. This is misleading
when trying to debug other issues, as it makes it look like the caught
exception caused a problem.

This passes the reraise=False keyword arg to the context manager and
sets the 'reraise' attribute to True only if we are not going to raise
a different exception.

Related-Bug: #1836212

Change-Id: Icce1e31fe3ebcbf9e4897bbfa57b7f3d1fba67a3
