The road to hell is paved with good intentions...

Let's revoke my change if it's gone too far..."}, {'account_id': 16635, 'date': '2019-01-23 15:42:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

Hi Ilya, firstly if its with good intentions then never ever mind where the path leads to, at least on the patches I own ;) Thank you for helping me on this patch to post the last few patch-sets and addressing the outstanding comments.

Now talking about the approach you have taken with the nomenlcature I seem to differ a bit from the perspective of defining the OEM entrypoint namespaces. According to recent patch set the resource OEM entry point namespaces will turn out to be nested based on their module hierarchy in sushy package. For instance, lets take ``storage`` as an example. The resource OEM extension namespace will be ``sushy.resources.system.storage.oems``. But ideally speaking storage can be nested under different types of resources such as:

    "/redfish/v1/Systems/{ComputerSystemId}/Storage/{StorageId}"
    "/redfish/v1/CompositionService/ResourceBlocks/{ResourceBlockId}/Storage/{StorageId}"
    "/redfish/v1/CompositionService/ResourceBlocks/{ResourceBlockId}/Systems/{ComputerSystemId}/Storage/{StorageId}"
    "/redfish/v1/ResourceBlocks/{ResourceBlockId}/Storage/{StorageId}"
    "/redfish/v1/ResourceBlocks/{ResourceBlockId}/Systems/{ComputerSystemId}/Storage/{StorageId}"

Hence IMO it's better to keep the resource OEM namespaces as ``sushy.resources.<underscore_joined_resource_name>.oems``, i.e. in a non nested manner. wdyt?

I am also planning to push a patch-set soon.'}, {'account_id': 16635, 'date': '2019-01-23 18:36:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 17.'}, {'account_id': 16635, 'date': '2019-01-23 18:40:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17:

Thanks Dmitry for putting your review comments and Ilya for promptly pursuing this and addressing those comments!'}, {'account_id': 16635, 'date': '2019-01-23 20:35:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 18.'}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2019-01-30 16:54:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 18:

(5 comments)

Hi Deb,

Thank you for keep working on this patch!

I've a few nits, but the meat of the matter is this:

> Hence IMO it's better to keep the resource OEM namespaces as ``sushy.resources.<underscore_joined_resource_name>.oems``, i.e. in a non nested manner. wdyt?

I've proposed this alternative approach to name spacing because I though that vendors might want to contain their OEM implementation on a more granular basis i.e. they may want 'storage' extension for 'system' and another (different and independently maintained) 'storage' extension for 'composition service'?

Or, if they want a single monolitic extension, that's still doable by registering all these entry points from a single package.

WDYT?"}, {'account_id': 16635, 'date': '2019-02-04 17:10:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18:

(5 comments)

Thanks Ilya! Will submit a new patch-set soon. Meanwhile please see my response.

> I've proposed this alternative approach to name spacing because I though that vendors might want to contain their OEM implementation on a more granular basis i.e. they may want 'storage' extension for 'system' and another (different and independently maintained) 'storage' extension for 'composition service'?

I guess I can understand where you are coming from. But actually I don't think that keeping independent and separate storage implementations under different schema would make sense from the vendor side. If your refer the storage schema documentation here: https://redfish.dmtf.org/schemas/v1/Storage.json you will get to see that the same Storage schema is to be available under various resources (search for attribute "uris"). So, essentially its the same Storage schema which is supposed to appear under different resources.'}, {'account_id': 16635, 'date': '2019-02-06 10:57:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 19.'}, {'account_id': 16635, 'date': '2019-02-06 10:58:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 19:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2019-02-06 14:03:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 19:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 16635, 'date': '2019-02-07 01:46:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2019-02-13 13:02:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 19: Code-Review-1

(8 comments)

This is really close, please see inline the final (hopefully) set of comments.

Also could you add a release note?'}, {'account_id': 16635, 'date': '2019-02-26 05:47:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 20.'}, {'account_id': 16635, 'date': '2019-02-26 05:52:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20:

(8 comments)

Thanks Dmitry for your final round (hopefully :-) ) of comments. I have submitted a new patch-set #20.

My apologies for being out of the last minute review rush for the past 2 weeks. Hopefully will be do my bit at the eleventh hour. Thank you!'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2019-02-26 23:00:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2019-02-27 15:13:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2019-02-28 10:22:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 20: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

(1 comment)

Re potential naming conflicts: a Resource can always override its resource_name to something non-conflicting.

Re regexps: let's do it in a follow-up, we have to release today.

Thanks all!"}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2019-07-23 16:57:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20:

@Debayan Just wondering, if you have a sushy extension package built on top of this OEM foundation? I am looking to building one, having an example would streamline my implementation...'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-05-10 16:54:05.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Add foundation for redfish OEM extensions

This patch adds the foundation structure for having resource
classes which can parse oem extension attributes.

TODO: Add unit test cases
TODO: More refinements are still needed

Change-Id: I6d64d27ec456e46c2cb5052f93a91d9e06ba82de
Partial-Bug: 1689605
'}, {'created': '2017-05-15 07:06:36.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Add foundation for redfish OEM extensions

This patch adds the foundation structure for having resource
classes which can parse oem extension attributes.

TODO: Add unit test cases
TODO: Some more refinements

Change-Id: I6d64d27ec456e46c2cb5052f93a91d9e06ba82de
Partial-Bug: 1689605
'}, {'created': '2017-05-17 07:42:43.000000000', 'message': "Add backbone for parsing redfish OEM extensions

* Create the foundation for resource classes which can parse
  oem extension attributes. In essence it provides a framework
  to dynamically load the varied oem resource extensions using
  stevedore. The target entry points are lazily invoked on
  demand.
* Entry points added with name 'contoso' in setup.cfg
* A new folder structure added for oem extensions modules -
  'sushy/resources/oem/'
* Base classes for System extensions and SystemCollection
  extensions added. It needs the OEM vendor string while
  initializing.
* Sushy (in main.py) starts accepting 'oem_vendor_string' in its
  constructor. Default value is None.
* Provides a fake resource extension for both System and
  SystemCollection as a ready reckoner for oems.
* Using the existing json samples which consists of Oem
  string as 'Contoso', a fictitious company, for unit testing
  purpose.
* Add Resource Oem extension related exceptions

Partial-Bug: 1689605
Change-Id: I6d64d27ec456e46c2cb5052f93a91d9e06ba82de
"}, {'created': '2017-10-03 10:38:43.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Add foundation for supporting redfish OEMs

This is to create the foundation for supporting resource
extensibility as proposed in Redfish specification [0]. In essence
it tries to provide a framework to dynamically load the varied oem
resource extensions using stevedore. The target entry points are
lazily invoked on demand. Other features as below:

* Provides API in Resource Base classes to discover the available OEM
  extensions. Also provides another API to get the resource extn
  object based on the OEM vendor string.
* Add Resource Oem extension related exception

[0] http://redfish.dmtf.org/schemas/DSP0266_1.1.html#resource-extensibility

Partial-Bug: 1689605

Change-Id: I6d64d27ec456e46c2cb5052f93a91d9e06ba82de
'}, {'created': '2017-10-03 11:04:13.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Add foundation for supporting redfish OEMs

This is to create the foundation for supporting resource
extensibility as proposed in Redfish specification [0]. In essence
it tries to provide a framework to dynamically load the varied oem
resource extensions using stevedore. The target entry points are
lazily invoked on demand. Other features as below:

* Provides API in Resource Base classes to discover the available OEM
  extensions. Also provides another API to get the resource extn
  object based on the OEM vendor string.
* Add Resource Oem extension related exception

[0] http://redfish.dmtf.org/schemas/DSP0266_1.1.html#resource-extensibility

Partial-Bug: 1689605

Change-Id: I6d64d27ec456e46c2cb5052f93a91d9e06ba82de
'}, {'created': '2017-10-06 11:06:28.000000000', 'message': "Add foundation for supporting redfish OEMs

This is to create the foundation for supporting resource
extensibility as proposed in Redfish specification [0]. In essence
it tries to provide a framework to dynamically load the varied oem
resource extensions using stevedore. The target entry points are
lazily invoked on demand. Other features as below:

* Provides an attribute 'available_oem_names' in Resource Base class
  to discover the available OEM extensions. Also provides another API
  to get the resource extension object based on the OEM vendor string.
* Provides the foundation for classes which can parse OEM extension
  attributes. Also a framework to dynamically load the varied OEM
  resource extensions using ``stevedore``. The target entry points
  are lazily invoked on demand.
* Entry points added with name 'Contoso' in setup.cfg
* A new folder structure added for oem extensions framework -
  'sushy/resources/oem/'
* Provides a fake resource extension as a ready reckoner for OEMs.
* Uses the existing json sample which consists of OEM string as
  'Contoso', a fictitious company, for unit testing purpose.
* Add Resource Oem extension related exceptions

[0] http://redfish.dmtf.org/schemas/DSP0266_1.1.html#resource-extensibility
Partial-Bug: 1689605

Change-Id: I6d64d27ec456e46c2cb5052f93a91d9e06ba82de
"}, {'created': '2018-09-10 13:31:33.000000000', 'message': "Add foundation for supporting redfish OEMs

This is to create the foundation for supporting resource
extensibility as proposed in Redfish specification [0]. In essence
it tries to provide a framework to dynamically load the varied oem
resource extensions using stevedore. The target entry points are
lazily invoked on demand. Other features as below:

* Provides an attribute 'available_oem_names' in Resource Base class
  to discover the available OEM extensions. Also provides another API
  to get the resource extension object based on the OEM vendor string.
* Provides the foundation for classes which can parse OEM extension
  attributes. Also a framework to dynamically load the varied OEM
  resource extensions using ``stevedore``. The target entry points

commit_message:
Add foundation for supporting Redfish OEMs

This is to create the foundation for supporting resource
extensibility as proposed in Redfish specification [0]. In essence
it tries to provide a framework to dynamically load the varied OEM
resource extensions using stevedore. The target entry points are
lazily invoked on demand. Other features as below:

* Provides an attribute 'oem_vendors' in Resource Base class
  to discover the available OEM extensions. Also provides another API
  to get the resource extension object based on the OEM vendor string.
* Provides the foundation for classes which can parse OEM extension
  attributes. Also a framework to dynamically load the varied OEM
  resource extensions using ``stevedore``. The target entry points
  are lazily invoked on demand.
* Entry points added with name 'contoso' in setup.cfg. All Entry point
  names are as lowercase_underscore_joined.
* A new folder structure added for OEM extensions framework -
  'sushy/resources/oem/'
* Provides a fake resource extension as a ready reckoner for OEMs.
* Uses the existing json sample which consists of OEM string as
  'Contoso', a fictitious company, for unit testing purpose.
* Add Resource OEM extension related exceptions

[0] http://redfish.dmtf.org/schemas/DSP0266_1.1.html#resource-extensibility

Story: 1689605
Task: 12039
Change-Id: I6d64d27ec456e46c2cb5052f93a91d9e06ba82de

commit_message:
Add additional gerrit plugin repos

To build 2.16 and 3.0 we need a few more plugin repos for
plugins that are now core plugins.

Change-Id: I12bc1ac64cfb9a7bbef1fcf5f0b020c16ced1ba5

commit_message:
[Redhat8] Add PythonInterpreter for standalone role

Set pythoninterpreter to python3 for rhel8 system while
creating standalone parameters.

Change-Id: I8f1c883c23dd5b2c93f1087434ba7af64fba0a18
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Sorin Sbarnea <ssbarnea@redhat.com>

[{'created': '2019-07-12 11:48:44.000000000', 'message': 'Yield control to other greenthreads while processing trusted ports

process_trusted_ports() appeared to be greenthread unfriendly, so
if there are many trusted ports on a node, openvswitch agent may
"hang" for a significant time.
This patch adds explicit yield.

Change-Id: I7c00812f877e2fc966bbac3060e1187ce1b809ca
Closes-Bug: #1836023
(cherry picked from commit da539da3780188f01e18ef106dde9ca180324c2a)
'}]
commit_message:
Yield control to other greenthreads while processing trusted ports

process_trusted_ports() appeared to be greenthread unfriendly, so
if there are many trusted ports on a node, openvswitch agent may
"hang" for a significant time.
This patch adds explicit yield.

Change-Id: I7c00812f877e2fc966bbac3060e1187ce1b809ca
Closes-Bug: #1836023
(cherry picked from commit da539da3780188f01e18ef106dde9ca180324c2a)

commit_message:
Refactor vitrage to use global CONF instead of local one

Remove usage of local config object in Vitrage
services and tests. Instead, it's been replaced
with the global CONF object. The structure of the
code becomes more like in other OpenStack projects.
Also, this change provides an opportunity to
introduce migrations and tests for them.

Story: 2004059
Task: 27065
Change-Id: I37544a350adf8ca38a6fc4ff5d0fd96e38a3f922

[{'account_id': 27589, 'date': '2018-01-19 21:15:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-01-19 21:16:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 27589, 'date': '2018-01-19 21:48:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 27589, 'date': '2018-01-19 21:49:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 8898, 'date': '2018-01-19 21:58:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

[{'created': '2019-05-08 10:31:12.000000000', 'message': "Enable keepalived VRRP health check

If you want to have vrrp watch the external networking interface
today, the option ha_vrrp_health_check_interval [1] detects a failure
it re-triggers the transitional change - which works if the external
physical interface fails because the ping will fail.

In fact, we've tried to enable it before [2], but then we had to
revert it [3] due to instability issues [4] in previous releases of
OpenStack. Maybe the previous instability issue [4] was caused by
another keepalived issue mentioned in the comment [5], now I have
tested this option again, it works.

This is how neutron allows monitoring southbound network today, so
I would suggest we add this capability into the charm again.

This is a patch for charm-neutron-openvswitch side to support
enable-dvr-snat=True option which allows running gateway components
on compute nodes (as of 19.04 charms, see [6])

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/ocata/networking-guide/ \
        deploy-ovs-ha-vrrp.html#keepalived-vrrp-health-check
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/601533/

commit_message:
Enable keepalived VRRP health check

If you want to have vrrp watch the external networking interface
today, the option ha_vrrp_health_check_interval [1] detects a failure
it re-triggers the transitional change - which works if the external
physical interface fails because the ping will fail.

In fact, we've tried to enable it before [2], but then we had to
revert it [3] due to instability issues [4] in previous releases of
OpenStack. Maybe the previous instability issue [4] was caused by
another keepalived issue mentioned in the comment [5], now I have
tested this option again, it works.

This is how neutron allows monitoring southbound network today, so
I would suggest we add this capability into the charm again.

This is a patch for charm-neutron-openvswitch side to support
enable-dvr-snat=True option which allows running gateway components
on compute nodes (as of 19.04 charms, see [6])

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/ocata/networking-guide/ \
        deploy-ovs-ha-vrrp.html#keepalived-vrrp-health-check
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/601533/
[3] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/603347/
[4] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1793102
[5] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1793102/comments/5
[6] https://bugs.launchpad.net/charm-neutron-openvswitch/+bug/1808045

Change-Id: Ic7e751dd876cc67805e841e109a4f955ad80be47
Closes-Bug: 1825966

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-12 13:33:33.000000000', 'message': 'Simplify placement.microversion:_fully_qualified_name

_fully_qualified_name was copied from Twisted. The original
version does more than Placement needs. We only need to
handle module-level classes and functions (and really only
functions). No nested of those, nor object methods in any
form.

This is because we only use the method for finding the
right microversioned handler of a method with the same
name and placement HTTP handlers are universally functions.

The previous version of the method had code that was never
called. Here, that dead code is removed and the remainder
is simplified.

If it is called incorrectly there will be an (intentionally)
untrapped TypeError during running of the tests.

N.B.: This was discovered while reviewing coverage data.

Change-Id: Id8f96801116818dda6c68c301619aee185e8fbff
'}]
commit_message:
Simplify placement.microversion:_fully_qualified_name

_fully_qualified_name was copied from Twisted. The original
version does more than Placement needs. We only need to
handle module-level classes and functions (and really only
functions). No nested of those, nor object methods in any
form.

This is because we only use the method for finding the
right microversioned handler of a method with the same
name and placement HTTP handlers are universally functions.

The previous version of the method had code that was never
called. Here, that dead code is removed and the remainder
is simplified.

If it is called incorrectly there will be an (intentionally)
untrapped TypeError during running of the tests.

N.B.: This was discovered while reviewing coverage data.

Change-Id: Id8f96801116818dda6c68c301619aee185e8fbff

commit_message:
Update api-ref location

The api documentation is now published on docs.openstack.org instead
of developer.openstack.org. Update all links that are changed to the
new location.

Note that Neutron publishes to api-ref/network, not networking anymore.

Note that redirects will be set up as well but let's point now to the
new location.

For details, see:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-July/007828.html

Change-Id: Id2cf3aa252df6db46575b5988e4937ecfc6792bb
